task.summary: Default task

character_classes.py renamed weaponry.attackDie to attack_die renamed CharacterSheet.__repr__ to full_str implemented characterSheet.melee_attack(self) - runs over equipped weapons, returns a dict with: - num: the number of attacks the character makes - effects: the effects to be applied to the attacked target - calculation: a damage function for the weapon: - this is to include character/class/race relevant bonus - weapons: the weaponry involved: - conveys the damage effects, and weapon attack function soon to make a similar variant for creature, given its somewhat more limited complexity wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block creatures.py: nothing important, just killed some whitespace encounter.py: further work towards implementing do_battle() enums.py: changed DAMAGETYPE subclasses to take arguments - can now instantiate self with given damage value a couple debug outs I haven't murdered yet. functions.py: dtypes no longer passed to GenericMelee.__init__() dtypes no longer a self value of GenericMelee.__init__() - contained within the weapon itself, or applied by its attack function, not needed here. misc.py: implemented a wrapper to call random as Die.random(self, upper) wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block weaponry.py: as mentioned in character_classes, renamed .attackDie to .attack_die renamed equipFuntion to equip_function

Simple Melee combat at last!
its come a long way, and it finally meets milestone 1, I can init a player, and some creatures, and they can try to kill eachother.
renamed the file character_classes to character_sheet
character_sheet: - moved init_wulfgar function to the end, so its out of the way - pushed the Equipment class out to its own file - pushed the events class out to its own file - added .is_lucky() - added .get_next_level_xp() - finished reworking get_attack - pushed __LINE__ debug function to its own file
classes: - removed the hitpoints_lvl1, its set under character_sheet with hit_die
creatures: - retagged the alias for dnd5e_weaponry to weaponry as I do elsewhere - gave creatures the equipment class, so they use same methods as player - changes default (dis)advantage vars to set() from None - added .atk_bonus and .effects vars - removed .check_attack() - removed .get_attack() - added .receive_damage() - added .melee_attack() - added ._wpn() - added .get_armor_class() - added Crab creature - added a few more fields to weapon: - atk_type: enums.ATTACK, set - wield_from: enums.EQUIP_SLOT, single - added more debug prints buried behind an if name == main block
encounter: - Party.__init__ now converts its args to list, from tuple - Party.size() added - Party.__str__() added - Encounter: - .init now copies Party Members rather than directly using - .do_battle() now has some text feedback - will remove in time - huge rewrite, pretty mch entirely new function - .generate_hostile() no involves party size mods, and difficulties - also not returns a reward dict - currently exp only - the simplistic battle routine buried in an if name == main block
enums: - changed enums import from * to as misc, related changes throughout - killed a couple debug prints - added GENERIC to WEAPONS type - added EQUIP_SLOT enum
events: - entirely new, though no new code, exiled from inside character_sheet
inventory: - entirely new, exiled from inside character_sheet - more internal variables, for more places to put gear - equip_weapon() now checks for jaw, hands, and fingers slots.
misc: - Die.__init__() no longer forces a min value of 2 sides - 1d1 possible - .random() altered to shortcut if 1 sided.
weaponry: - importing ATTACK and EQUIP_SLOT enums - .__init__() args changed, added atk_type - sets self.atk_type and self.wield_from now as well - greataxe test def altered to set atk_type and wield_from
trace: - entirely new, added to carry any debug related functions worth having - implemented __LINE__(), which behaves as __FILE__+_+__LINE__ does in C

Rudimentary leveling now works
fixed an issue with creature weapons lacking weapon.flags not having their attack_die set.
fixed encounter continuing and calling choice on a party which has already been eliminated.
Character_sheet: - experience now hides behind a getter/setter. Setter calls levelup - levelup handled via re-calling __init__, inserting current stats - .__init__() modified to check if relevant attributes are None or set, if none they are defaulted, if set they are used as is - ._wpn() now used hand.roll instead of hand.attack_die.roll()
Classes: - Barbarian: - class_ability is no longer defaulted unless not assigned - .__init__() now takes many configuration arguments, to pass in state - tests those for None, if None, defaults, else keeps what was passed
Creatures: - like with character_sheet, ._wpn() now uses hand.roll()
encounter: - Party.__str__() now includes character level in its return - Encounter.do_battle() now tests for active party internally too - immediately after selecting a weapon, but before choosing a target fixes trying to choose target from a party with no members - removed the per-hit input(), now runs the entire encounter at once. - now returns a dict for failure as well rather than just zero - Encounter.generate_hostile(): - currently returns exp equal to stated for creatures - this is for testing purposes to accelerate growth. - it will not stay this fast - if name == main: - now tests sum of hp for player one and two before terminating. - divides the rewards among the players - sets their hp to max after each iteration
inventory: - had a case where creatures were not setting flags on their weapons - this caused Weapon.equip_weapon() to not assign its attack die fixed
weaponry: - Weapon.roll() was still using the old .attackDie name, retagged it

quick housecleaning update
character_sheet: - CharacterSheet now inherits from common Entity class - re-organised and stripped some variables that Entity now owns - .set_saving_throws() now belongs to Entity - .is_lucky() now belongs to Entity - .melee_attack() now belongs to Entity - ._wpn() now belongs to Entity - receive_damage() now belongs to entity - .get_attack() is eliminated - debug block now import print from trace - minor edits to the print statements to reflect change
classes: - appended background.skills to self.skills
creatures: - Creature now inherits from common Entity class - re-organised and stripped some variables that Entity now owns - .set_saving_throws() now belongs to Entity - .is_lucky() now belongs to Entity - .melee_attack() now belongs to Entity - ._wpn() now belongs to Entity - receive_damage() now belongs to entity - minor edits to the print statements int he debug block
encounter: - debug block now import print from trace - minor edits to the print statements to reflect change
entity: - Entity created from common features of Creature and CharacterSheet
enums: - BACKGROUND.SKILL renamed to .SKILLS, its a set of multiple, pluralise
trace: - new function print() - overrides default print function. - inserts __LINE__() before given args

quick bugfix and update to encounter test code Forgot to check target armor class, so no one was ever missing, lol.
character_sheet: - silenced the 'level up' print in CharacterSheet.level_up() - added level to .dict_short()
encounter: - Encounter.init() - added verbose, silent, auto_run and debug_rewards parameters - Encounter.do_battle() - wrapped the prints behind tests for verbose and silent - wrapped the input that halts iteration behind a test for auto_run - killed some old commented code - attacks now get target ac, attack rolls less than target ac miss - XP_thresholds now has 7 difficulty levels - each is 2/3 of the next - test code now runs until level 20 is reached

encounter: - fixed criticals, critical attacks now double damage as planned
enums: - added DamageType.__Damage.__mull__() - added DamageType.__Damage.__imull__() - added DamageType.__Damage.__rmull__()
misc: - attack_roll() now checks critical against roll, was attack_roll

a huge milestone was crossed with this update - a preliminary implementation of the event system is now in place - pending survival...
Work will now proceed on the remaining class traits for the barbarian class, barring any issues, this implementation survives as is, otherwise it is, as ever, subject to obliteration - initial prognosis is promising
armor: - Armor.__init__() now is entirely keyword arguments - added equip_to argument - Armor.Shield super call altered to match Armor.__init__ - armor test definition altered accordingly.
character_sheet: - added iteration of the traits list to trigger event 'installation' - CharacterSheet.level_up() is now a looped process - killed some commented out code - minor changes to the test code
encounter: - Encounter.do_battle(): - now import enums.EVENT - attacks dict replaced with attack object - for atk in attacks look replaced with while attack.num - misc.attack_roll() replaced with call to attack.result() - attack log now indicates when criticals happen - added event calls for before_turn, attack, critical, defend, death, after_battle, and after_turn
entity: - added Entity.equip() wrapper call for accessing self.equipment - added Entity.unequip() wrapper call for accessing self.equipment - stripped attack trigger from Entity.melee_attack() - now generates a class object rather than a dictionary
enums: - CLASS_TRAITS attributes are not classes anymore, but same named vars - assigned functions.ClassTrait<Name> to attaribute <NAME> - DAMAGE_TYPES now has __add__, __sub__, __div__, and respective i and r variants - ARMOR is now a three tier nested class enumeration - added EVENT enum with : - INIT, EQUIP, UNEQUIP, BEFORE_BATTLE, AFTER_BATTLE, BEFORE_TURN, AFTER_TURN, BEFORE_ACTION, AFTER_ACTION, ATTACK, DEFEND, CRITICAL, LEVEL_UP, REST_LONG, REST_SHORT, ROLL_ATTACK, ROLL_DAMAGE, ROLL_DC, ROLL_HP, DEATH, AND HEAL - very likely this will grow considerably. - if __name__ == '__main__' test block
events: - Event.Effect.__call__() doesn't return anything now - previous limited set of event lists are not class attributes, they are now instance attributes, and there are more of them - one for every event in enums.EVENT
functions: Massive expansion, the bulk of the effort happened here. - GenericAttack and GenericMelee commented out for now - full implementation of ClassTraitRage - preliminary instantiation of the following ClassTrait<Name>: - UnarmoredDefence, RecklessAttack, DangerSense, ExtraAttack, FastMovement, FeralInstinct, BrutalCritical, RelentlessRage, PersistentRage, IndomitableMight, PrimalChampion, Frenzy, MindlessRage, IntimidatingPresence, Retaliation, SpiritSeeker, SpiritWalker, TotemBear, TotemEagle, TotemWolf, AspectBear, AspectEagle, AspectWolf, AttuneBear, AttuneEagle, AttuneWolf - test code block at bottom behind if __name__ == '__main__':
inventory: - Equipped.equip_weapon() now uses attribute equip_to, no wield_from - .get_equipped() implemented - .unequip() implemented - .unequip_slot() implemented
items: - Item.__init__() equip_to added to parameters - added to self as well
misc: - eliminated the Event code - it doesn't need to be in two places - pushed the Die roll average roll count from 10k, to 1m - eliminated attack_roll() - cleaned up the test code outputs
weaponry: - converted Weapon.__init__() parameters to named parameters - added equip_to to super() call to match changes to Item - Weapon no longer stores wield_from, attribute eliminated
trace: - added offset parameter to print overload, enabling selection of which context's file_line is printed out.

a mixed bug stomping / progress update - there were some serious flaws in the code for the event system, in particular with identifying instances of a class and appending instances of a trait as causes of the effect
Progress has been made in implementing the barbarian's traits, and some related needs along the way.
character_sheet: - player_race now instantiates a new instance of self at the new level rather than carrying the old instance - which prevented gaining traits - NATURAL_DEFENCE is now a default trait of entities. - the init() event is thrown at the end of character_sheet.__init__() - the level_up event is thrown at the end of character_sheet.level_up()
encounter: - .do_Battle doesn't import enums.EVENT anymore - critical attacks now triggers the attacker's critical event - rewrote how damage is applied to a target - effects.defnd now expects 4 keywords: - attacker: the attacker's object - attack: the attacker's attack object - defender: the target of the attack - typically self, but might be a party member for defence events relating to party members - defence: a defence object to be loaded with the reply - a defence object is created, and passed to the target's defend subscribers for updating with damage modifiers, and effects for the target to suffer as a consequence (like thorns) - target.hp < 1 now triggers the target's death event
entity: - un-named entities are now given a default name: 'an Entity is No One' - attributes advantage, disadvantage, damage_resist, damage_vulnerable, end proficiency_skills changed from type set() to type Event.Effects._none via wrapper function Event.none()
enums: - ABILITY's members now have an affectors attribute - used to list what effects have given this effect - ATTACK's members now have an affectors attribute - ADVANTAGE's members ATTACK and DEFENCE are now attributes referencing the same named enum classes - DAMAGE_TYPE: - __init__(): - damage parameter defaults to None - affectors attribute added - __repr__(): - now returns class name if it lacks a .damage attribute - all member .__init__() funcitons now default damage to None
events: - Event.__repr__() no long imports sys for sys.stdout.flush - sys.stdout.flush call removed - .get(self, item) implemented - used to find instances of a type within the set - .__init__() now also setsup lists for heal and _none events. - _none is there to allow none event, but similar functioning lists to abuse the same code and stay out of the way.
functions: - TraitsBase.__call__() eliminated - TraitsBase.add_affector(self, what, where) implemented - TraitsBase.remove_affector(self, what, where) implemented - TraitNaturalDefence implemented - ClassTraitRage: - .__init__() now calls add_affector to append damage resistances - .uninstall() now calls remove_affector to strip damage resistances - .equip_change now conditionally calls uninstall rather than always - ClassTraitUnarmoredDefence implemented - ClassTraitRecklessAttack implemented
misc: - class Defend added for use by defence events - currently just assembles a list of armor_class results - get_armor_class returns the largest value in the results - getAdvantage tests changed to account for changes in event system
trace: - added line function to get the current line the code is on.

progress update - the event system has gained some further refinements, some bug's have gotten squashed as they were encountered, and a large degree of trace capability was introduced to ease further debugging.
It is potentially very verbose right now, due to all of the debug printouts which are hiding behind a simple boolean. The boolean flags are in encounter, events, and functions
armor: - .flags attribute removed - Plate armor weight fixed, its not 7 lbs, its 65 lbs - breastplate added to aid in testing the Rage trait
character_sheet: - .__init__() parameters now include unspent points from leveling up - passed value to Entity via super().__init__ parameter - .level_up() now checks for, and passes unspent points for the re-init - .get_armor_class() is testing armor.enum_type now, not armor.flags - test function init_wulfgar now uses breastplate instead of plate.
encounter: - re-organised a few things that aren't order dependent to be first - added a few more event triggers
entity: - Entity.__init__() parameters now includes unspent ability points - .status and .unspent_ability attributes added - equip and unequip events added to the equip and unequip wrapper funcs - .save_roll() added, yielding a common place to trigger events from.
enums: - the SKILL enum's members are now instantiatable, with affectors
events: - Event.Effect.__call__() now responds with debug info: - the line of code it was called with - the event name, host name, and affector - incapacitated, move, and proficiency_check events added.
functions: - TraitsBase.__init__() now calls ._install(), rather than .install() - .install() retagged to ._install() - ._install() now queried each functions that is registered with it for methods with names that match event names, and installs them there when found
child install methods are handled by calling them as the last step of this installation methof - .uninstall, same as happened to .install - .add_affector(): - very verbose debugging info added - destination is now a string rather than the target reference - .remove_affector() - very verbose debugging info added - destination is now a string rather than the target reference - implemented: TraitAbilityScoreImprovement, DCThrow - TraitNaturalDefence - trimmed the error handling - errors indicate there is a bug - ClassTraitRage: - trimmed the error handling - errors indicate there is a bug - added a few more flags to its __init__ - stripped the now redundant install and uninstall functions - added a little debug printing to trace its activities - improved its logic somewhat - ClassTraitUnarmoredDefence: - trimmed the error handling - errors indicate there is a bug - stripped the now redundant install and uninstall functions - ensured equip_change is aliased to both equip and unequip - appended *args, **kwargs to parameters for methods - ClassTraitRecklessAttack: - trimmed the error handling - errors indicate there is a bug - stripped the now redundant install and uninstall functions - littered it with debug print outs to trace its activities - attack method implemented - before_turn method implemented - implemented methods: ClassTraitExtraAttack, ClassTraitFastMovement, ClassTraitFeralInstinct, ClassTraitBrutalCritical, RaceTraitLucky
misc: - Attack object now carries the critical multiplier as an attribute
trace: - called_with() method implemented - retrieves and cleans up the calling line of code two frames ago, which for called with, is whoever called the frame that called this

Further implementation work on th events system, related triggers such as die rolls, incapacitation, preliminary work setting up statuses, and more barbarian traits.
characterSheet: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - .__init__() now checks for needing to level up the character based on given experience - .get_next_level_xp(): added a level 21 with absurd exp needs - expanded the debug block at the bottom of the file
classes: - the barbarian now substitutes the rage traits as they level: - persistent rage replaces relentless rage - relentless rage replaces rage
encounter: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - do_battle.print_parties() implemented rather than just a set of statements at the start of do_battle(). - when entity begins turn with hp<=0 and incapacitated event is thrown, if entity hp increases as a consequence, they are returned to their party - added call to event.roll_attack() - added some more to the debug test block
entity: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - now imports NamedTuple from dnd5e_misc - Entity.__init__(): - moved, changed, and renamed assignment statements for advantage, disadvantage, damage_resist, damage_vulnerable, proficiency_skills, temporary_hitpoints, actions, and status - each was renamed from <name> to _<name> - each occurs in a block at the very end now - each assigns Event() rather than Event.none() now - added assignment of a die(1,20) to self.d20 - added self.._immunity assignment as Event() - added @property and @var.setter functions for each of advantage, disadvantage, damage_resist, damage_vulnerable, proficiency_skills, temporary_hitpoints, actions, and status - @property returns self._name.none - @var.setter assigns to self._var.none - method is_lucky eliminated in favour of Lucky event function - reworked flow of _wpn, to utilise event.roll_damage() - renamed save_roll() to roll_dc() - reworked roll_dc to trigger event.roll_dc()
enums: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Ability now has protected attributes _max_<var> for each of STR, CON, DEX, INT, WIS, and CHA. That is, self._max_DEX now exists - overloaded .__setattr__ to intercept assignments to apply the limit(s) referenced in the new _max_ vars to attributes - implemented a set_max() method to assign new values to the protected maximums - TRAIT.Lucky now references a trait function - STATUS members have all now received preliminary implementations: - all inherit from common Call class, which implements __call__ method and creates self.affectors list - all now have .__init__() methods - added ENRAGED and FRENZIED statuses - DAMAGETYPE methods .__idiv__() and .__rdiv__() renamed to the correct python 3.0 names .__itruediv__() and .__ifloordiv__(), respectively
events: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Event.Effects._none retagged to .none
functions: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - TraitsBase._-init__() - added reference to self.host.effects as self.events - implemented preliminary functions for Status<stat> where <stat> is an element of this list: Blinded, Charmed, Dead, Deafened, Frightened, Grappled, Incapacitated, Invisible, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Stunned, Unconscious, Enraged, Frenzied - fully implemented StatusExhausted - testing required - classTraitRage now has attributes since_last_attack, and rage_length_max, both used to dynamically control the limits of rage - now adds self to effects attribute of attack objects in attack event - ClassTraitRelentlessRage now inherits from ClassTraitRage, rather than TraitsBase - fully implemented methods for incapacitated, rest_long, and rest_short events - ClassTraitPersistentRage now inherits form ClassTraitRelentlessRage, rather than TraitsBase. - sets since_last_attack and rage_length_max to 999999999 - ClassTraitIndomitableMight now fully implemented - ClassTraitPrimalChampion now fully implemented - ClassTraitFrenzy now fully implemented - ClassTraitLucky now fully implemented - WeaponEffectsGSTQ2H implemented
misc: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Attack: - attack_die is now a class attribute, rather than instance - get() method added, to allow searching the self.effects attribute, for instantiated or uninstantiated instances of class objects - self.roll method eliminated - self.roll1 and self.roll2 attributes added. - set_rolls() method added - rolled_one() method eliminated
weaponry: - now imports all from functions - Weaponry.roll() no returns None when no die, rather than zero - implemented GSTQ2H weapon

A big sideways push. There is now a means to interactively create characters, rather than hardcoded characters only.
classes: - expanded all class configs to carry a new attribute, skills_qty - appended the missing skills for the other classes(than barbarian) - added ability_suggest dict attribute - changed the barbarian to carry the whole trait set on the class level
encounter: - now imports interactions - remembers the previous target - the debug code block now iters the potential actions a player could take - this will be expanded to actually control an encounter if the player is taking direct control.
entity: - no longer imports Skill and Trait from enums - now imports a location object - will be put to use soon in carrying positional data
enums: - TRAIT.BRAVE now references a null function as a test case for preliminary assignment without implementation - BACKGROUNDS now all have both SKILLS and TOOLS variables
functions: - added class RaceTraitBrave(TraitsBase):pass to test non-implementation
interactions: - entirely new - new_user() spits out an informational string - get_value_from_curve() takes a range, and deviation, throws a random value in that range and returns the result - getAbility() interacts directly with the user, to get an assignment for the default array [15,14,13,12,10,8] to the ability scores - new() spins up a new character, interacting with the user to make the choices along the way. - ActionHelp() gives a quick help output for combat actions you can take -- almost entirely not implemented at current. - print_choices(), a helper function that enumerates and linebreaks a set of options - get_implemented_names() takes a source, and destination, compares them and reports on how thoroughly implemented the source is. - ChooseCombatAction() is a preliminary top level turn control function which will end up being the primary interaction with players in encounters.
misc: - a new class, Location, will eventually have a roll in entity positions - getint() shamelessly stole this from another project of mine - getstr() shamelessly stole this from another project of mine
races: - races now have the age, height, and weight range information at the class level, so its possible to place new characters on the range before instantiating.

Quick preparatory update - Ripped Encounter.do_battle to pieces. This is the first step towards integrating choice of action, and terminal interaction with the do_battle function.
actions: - new file, will be hosting all of the action specific code here. - do_battle's main loop is going to be moved here eventually - some of do_battles helper functions will end up here eventually - dummy functions laid out
encounter: - retagged player_party to party1 - retagged hostile_party to party2 - method generate_hostile(): - renamed to generate_party2 - no longer requires parameter difficulty - initiative list creation now wrapped in a method, before_battle() - player boolean eliminated, party # is a temporary self var of each entity, assigned during creation of initiative list, removed at end of encounter - entity target selection now wrapped in a method, get_target() - everything form target selection, to creation of the defend object now wrapped in a method, attack_roll() - everything from creation of the defend object to hit decision now wrapped in a method, target_defence() - target_ac > attack_roll true case now wrapped in a method, miss() - target_ac > attack_roll true case now wrapped in a method, target_hit() - new methods, before_battle, after_battle, target_defence, attack_roll, get_target, target_hit, miss, incapacitate_target
functions: - TraitsBase methods add_affector and remove_affector moved outside the class, wrapper of same name still held internally. - Permits actions to use the affector system, without needing them to be inheritors of TraitsBase. Inheritors need only specify what the affector is and where it belongs. Non-inheritors must also specify the host and token,

The brain-melty task of using the event system, from outside the event system, which is not really how I intended it when I made it, but how actions are clearly best handled, has been resolved. Some minor changes resulted.
Initial combat actions Dodge, and Assist are now ready to tie into Encounter.do_battle(), as is Attack which was the first one implemented.
Work on implementing user interaction inside do_battle will now begin.
The next step after terminal interaction to control battles, is creation of battles via terminal interaction, either as an auto fight vs creatures, an interactive fight vs creatures, or a duel vs other players.
Following that will be tying terminal interactions, to the discord api.
actions: - gave it the now standard trace.print debug init block - littered a few todo's - implemented CombatAssist - implemented CombatDodge - implemented a test block to verify functionality
encounter: - do_battle no longer calls self.target_defence or defence.get_armor_class() - Now wrapped up inside of Encounter.attack_roll() method. - weapon damage is now set in two stages, giving defence events a chance to edit the result before the critical multiplier is applied.
events: - added another event category, battle_cleanup(), used to strip effects which did not get a chance to remove themselves from characters
functions: - kicked methods add_affector and remove_affector over to misc to resolve a circular import issue. They sort of belong in misc more anyways - all set.remove() calls replaced with set.discard(), remove throws an exception if the item being removed is not found, discard does not.
misc: - now has methods add_affector, and remove_affector, moved here from functions

ITS INTERACTIVE!
That said, testing is still needed to explore all the choices, find flaws and eliminate them, etc. I am already aware that enrage seems to not respond correctly. I assume it is not activating, because it is re-inserting itself in the actions list.
Because it does not currently run full auto, it is not tested through all levels up to 20 as per usual - un-noticed issues may be present.
The hostile creatures currently also have no autonomy, its purely human run at this time.
Its technically possible now to instantiate multiple characters, form parties, and fight them, or seek suitable opponents from the generate_hostiles function in encounters. This includes duels, since you would only need spawn two characters, and assign one to party1, the other to party2.
It is technically feasible to interact via discord now. Its perhaps a bit too verbose, but time will clean that up, this is simply iteration 1
Feel free to start working up bot interactions. All terminal interactions are candidates for discord interaction.
As time provides I will test, and perhaps also begin bot interactions.

a mixed bug stomping / progress update - there were some serious flaws in the code for the event system, in particular with identifying instances of a class and appending instances of a trait as causes of the effect
Progress has been made in implementing the barbarian's traits, and some related needs along the way.
character_sheet: - player_race now instantiates a new instance of self at the new level rather than carrying the old instance - which prevented gaining traits - NATURAL_DEFENCE is now a default trait of entities. - the init() event is thrown at the end of character_sheet.__init__() - the level_up event is thrown at the end of character_sheet.level_up()
encounter: - .do_Battle doesn't import enums.EVENT anymore - critical attacks now triggers the attacker's critical event - rewrote how damage is applied to a target - effects.defnd now expects 4 keywords: - attacker: the attacker's object - attack: the attacker's attack object - defender: the target of the attack - typically self, but might be a party member for defence events relating to party members - defence: a defence object to be loaded with the reply - a defence object is created, and passed to the target's defend subscribers for updating with damage modifiers, and effects for the target to suffer as a consequence (like thorns) - target.hp < 1 now triggers the target's death event

progress update - the event system has gained some further refinements, some bug's have gotten squashed as they were encountered, and a large degree of trace capability was introduced to ease further debugging.

encounter: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - do_battle.print_parties() implemented rather than just a set of statements at the start of do_battle(). - when entity begins turn with hp<=0 and incapacitated event is thrown, if entity hp increases as a consequence, they are returned to their party - added call to event.roll_attack() - added some more to the debug test block
entity: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - now imports NamedTuple from dnd5e_misc - Entity.__init__(): - moved, changed, and renamed assignment statements for advantage, disadvantage, damage_resist, damage_vulnerable, proficiency_skills, temporary_hitpoints, actions, and status - each was renamed from <name> to _<name> - each occurs in a block at the very end now - each assigns Event() rather than Event.none() now - added assignment of a die(1,20) to self.d20 - added self.._immunity assignment as Event() - added @property and @var.setter functions for each of advantage, disadvantage, damage_resist, damage_vulnerable, proficiency_skills, temporary_hitpoints, actions, and status - @property returns self._name.none - @var.setter assigns to self._var.none - method is_lucky eliminated in favour of Lucky event function - reworked flow of _wpn, to utilise event.roll_damage() - renamed save_roll() to roll_dc() - reworked roll_dc to trigger event.roll_dc()
enums: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Ability now has protected attributes _max_<var> for each of STR, CON, DEX, INT, WIS, and CHA. That is, self._max_DEX now exists - overloaded .__setattr__ to intercept assignments to apply the limit(s) referenced in the new _max_ vars to attributes - implemented a set_max() method to assign new values to the protected maximums - TRAIT.Lucky now references a trait function - STATUS members have all now received preliminary implementations: - all inherit from common Call class, which implements __call__ method and creates self.affectors list - all now have .__init__() methods - added ENRAGED and FRENZIED statuses - DAMAGETYPE methods .__idiv__() and .__rdiv__() renamed to the correct python 3.0 names .__itruediv__() and .__ifloordiv__(), respectively
events: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Event.Effects._none retagged to .none
functions: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - TraitsBase._-init__() - added reference to self.host.effects as self.events - implemented preliminary functions for Status<stat> where <stat> is an element of this list: Blinded, Charmed, Dead, Deafened, Frightened, Grappled, Incapacitated, Invisible, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Stunned, Unconscious, Enraged, Frenzied - fully implemented StatusExhausted - testing required - classTraitRage now has attributes since_last_attack, and rage_length_max, both used to dynamically control the limits of rage - now adds self to effects attribute of attack objects in attack event - ClassTraitRelentlessRage now inherits from ClassTraitRage, rather than TraitsBase - fully implemented methods for incapacitated, rest_long, and rest_short events - ClassTraitPersistentRage now inherits form ClassTraitRelentlessRage, rather than TraitsBase. - sets since_last_attack and rage_length_max to 999999999 - ClassTraitIndomitableMight now fully implemented - ClassTraitPrimalChampion now fully implemented - ClassTraitFrenzy now fully implemented - ClassTraitLucky now fully implemented - WeaponEffectsGSTQ2H implemented
misc: - added a little debug block to use the trace print as debug() - when false, is used as a conditional / dummy statement via lambda - changed all debug prints to call debug() rather than print() - Attack: - attack_die is now a class attribute, rather than instance - get() method added, to allow searching the self.effects attribute, for instantiated or uninstantiated instances of class objects - self.roll method eliminated - self.roll1 and self.roll2 attributes added. - set_rolls() method added - rolled_one() method eliminated
weaponry: - now imports all from functions - Weaponry.roll() no returns None when no die, rather than zero - implemented GSTQ2H weapon

A big sideways push. There is now a means to interactively create characters, rather than hardcoded characters only.
classes: - expanded all class configs to carry a new attribute, skills_qty - appended the missing skills for the other classes(than barbarian) - added ability_suggest dict attribute - changed the barbarian to carry the whole trait set on the class level
encounter: - now imports interactions - remembers the previous target - the debug code block now iters the potential actions a player could take - this will be expanded to actually control an encounter if the player is taking direct control.
entity: - no longer imports Skill and Trait from enums - now imports a location object - will be put to use soon in carrying positional data
enums: - TRAIT.BRAVE now references a null function as a test case for preliminary assignment without implementation - BACKGROUNDS now all have both SKILLS and TOOLS variables
functions: - added class RaceTraitBrave(TraitsBase):pass to test non-implementation
interactions: - entirely new - new_user() spits out an informational string - get_value_from_curve() takes a range, and deviation, throws a random value in that range and returns the result - getAbility() interacts directly with the user, to get an assignment for the default array [15,14,13,12,10,8] to the ability scores - new() spins up a new character, interacting with the user to make the choices along the way. - ActionHelp() gives a quick help output for combat actions you can take -- almost entirely not implemented at current. - print_choices(), a helper function that enumerates and linebreaks a set of options - get_implemented_names() takes a source, and destination, compares them and reports on how thoroughly implemented the source is. - ChooseCombatAction() is a preliminary top level turn control function which will end up being the primary interaction with players in encounters.
misc: - a new class, Location, will eventually have a roll in entity positions - getint() shamelessly stole this from another project of mine - getstr() shamelessly stole this from another project of mine
races: - races now have the age, height, and weight range information at the class level, so its possible to place new characters on the range before instantiating.

Quick preparatory update - Ripped Encounter.do_battle to pieces. This is the first step towards integrating choice of action, and terminal interaction with the do_battle function.
actions: - new file, will be hosting all of the action specific code here. - do_battle's main loop is going to be moved here eventually - some of do_battles helper functions will end up here eventually - dummy functions laid out
encounter: - retagged player_party to party1 - retagged hostile_party to party2 - method generate_hostile(): - renamed to generate_party2 - no longer requires parameter difficulty - initiative list creation now wrapped in a method, before_battle() - player boolean eliminated, party # is a temporary self var of each entity, assigned during creation of initiative list, removed at end of encounter - entity target selection now wrapped in a method, get_target() - everything form target selection, to creation of the defend object now wrapped in a method, attack_roll() - everything from creation of the defend object to hit decision now wrapped in a method, target_defence() - target_ac > attack_roll true case now wrapped in a method, miss() - target_ac > attack_roll true case now wrapped in a method, target_hit() - new methods, before_battle, after_battle, target_defence, attack_roll, get_target, target_hit, miss, incapacitate_target
functions: - TraitsBase methods add_affector and remove_affector moved outside the class, wrapper of same name still held internally. - Permits actions to use the affector system, without needing them to be inheritors of TraitsBase. Inheritors need only specify what the affector is and where it belongs. Non-inheritors must also specify the host and token,

The brain-melty task of using the event system, from outside the event system, which is not really how I intended it when I made it, but how actions are clearly best handled, has been resolved. Some minor changes resulted.
Initial combat actions Dodge, and Assist are now ready to tie into Encounter.do_battle(), as is Attack which was the first one implemented.
Work on implementing user interaction inside do_battle will now begin.
The next step after terminal interaction to control battles, is creation of battles via terminal interaction, either as an auto fight vs creatures, an interactive fight vs creatures, or a duel vs other players.
Following that will be tying terminal interactions, to the discord api.
actions: - gave it the now standard trace.print debug init block - littered a few todo's - implemented CombatAssist - implemented CombatDodge - implemented a test block to verify functionality
encounter: - do_battle no longer calls self.target_defence or defence.get_armor_class() - Now wrapped up inside of Encounter.attack_roll() method. - weapon damage is now set in two stages, giving defence events a chance to edit the result before the critical multiplier is applied.
events: - added another event category, battle_cleanup(), used to strip effects which did not get a chance to remove themselves from characters
functions: - kicked methods add_affector and remove_affector over to misc to resolve a circular import issue. They sort of belong in misc more anyways - all set.remove() calls replaced with set.discard(), remove throws an exception if the item being removed is not found, discard does not.
misc: - now has methods add_affector, and remove_affector, moved here from functions

ITS INTERACTIVE!
That said, testing is still needed to explore all the choices, find flaws and eliminate them, etc. I am already aware that enrage seems to not respond correctly. I assume it is not activating, because it is re-inserting itself in the actions list.
Because it does not currently run full auto, it is not tested through all levels up to 20 as per usual - un-noticed issues may be present.
The hostile creatures currently also have no autonomy, its purely human run at this time.
Its technically possible now to instantiate multiple characters, form parties, and fight them, or seek suitable opponents from the generate_hostiles function in encounters. This includes duels, since you would only need spawn two characters, and assign one to party1, the other to party2.
It is technically feasible to interact via discord now. Its perhaps a bit too verbose, but time will clean that up, this is simply iteration 1
Feel free to start working up bot interactions. All terminal interactions are candidates for discord interaction.
As time provides I will test, and perhaps also begin bot interactions.

functions: - preliminary implementation of: ActionCombatSearch, ActionCombatReady, ActionCombatUse, ActionCombatDash, ActionCombatDisengage, ActionCombatHide, - implemented: ActionCombatAssist, ActionCombatDodge, ActionCombatAttack - ClassTraitRage: - now has an is_action method - now has stop/begin raging methods - battle_cleanup method eliminated - equip_change now calls _(un)install, rather than (un)install - no longer autofires, awaits player decision - ClassTraitRecklessAttack: - now has an is_action method - no longer autofires, awaits player decision - ClassTraitFrenzy: - now has an is_action method - no longer autofires, awaits player decision - now has end_frenzy method

Character creation via discord is now a thing. Early implementation of database code for saving/loading characters - entirely untested. Work proceeds on to_dict() / from_dict() object functions so they can also be saved/loaded to/from the database.
